bibl.title: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Harvey Cushing, June 30, 1925

div1.p: Kean sends Cushing reprints of his review of the Gorgas biography.

div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Harvey Cushing, June 30, 1925
div1.opener:
June 30, 1925.
Dr. Harvey Cushing,
Peter Bent Brigham Hospital,
Boston, Mass.
My dear Dr. Cushing:
div1.p:
I recollect with pleasure how keenly interested
you have always been in whatever related to Walter Reed
and his work in Havana, and therefore it has occurred to
me that you would like to see a review of the recent biog-
raphy of General Gorgas in which some new side lights on
Reed's work are given and an attempt is made to create the
impression given by the authors (Burton J. Hendrick and
Mrs. Gorgas) where it does an injustice to Reed. I have
had so many complimentary letters on this review, both in
and out of the service, that it has evidently struck a note
of interest among those interested in the conquest of yellow
fever.

I am glad to see by the papers that your book is
out and am looking forward with great interest to the pleas-
ure of reading it.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, J. R. KEAN
Colonel, U.S. Army, Retired
Editor. JRK/W
